attributes.action: introduce legislation to require candidates for election to Parliament to specify how much they wish to be paid per annum, including expenses, for the term of the Parliament, and for this amount to printed next to the candidate's name on the ballot paper.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Under this legislation, every MP would be paid whatever they liked, so long as the electorate voted for them. There would need to be safeguards to ensure that political parties didn't subsidise their MPs. Not only would this remove all arguments about MPs' pay and expenses, it would make for very interesting elections. Candidates who were prepared to live frugally could stand in safe seats and present a real challenge to the sitting MPs. It would have the added benefit of making opinion pollsters' jobs a lot more difficult.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
